Setting.Name: Number of Trials for Each Class
End of Trial Minimum Duration (in sec)
End of Trial Maximum Duration (in sec)

Comment.Text: Finally, the feature vectors are classifier with an LDA classifier. Note that the state vector of the classifier (which in the case of the LDA is the distance to the separation plane) is sent to the Graz Visulization box for feedback ! In order to display correct feedback, the Graz Visulization box expects a negative value for one class and a positive value for the other class.

Then comes the feature extraction part. The signal is filtered in the alpha/beta [8 24] Hz range. The filtered signal is then splitted in blocks of 1 second every 16th second and the logarithmic band power is computed thanks to the two Simple DSP and the Signal Average boxes. The matrices can then be converted in feature vectors. note: depending on what frequency range reacts best for the subject, you may have to tune this part of the scenario note: whatever change you do on this scenario, don't forget to do the same on the classifier trainer scenario
You can browse each box' documentation by selecting the box and pressing F1
Overview This scenario can be used online once the classifiers is trained. note: the recorded files go to the folder where the scenario xml is located (${Player_ScenarioDirectory}/).

The preprocessing of this scenario consists in re-referencing all the channels to the channel 2 (which was located on the nose) and to select the 10 channels over the motor cortex of the hands. The Spatial Filter box computes a surface laplacian filter and reduces the output to two channels: one on the left and one on the right. note: depending on your acquisition device, you may have to tune this part of the scenario note: whatever change you do on this scenario, don't forget to do the same on the classifier trainer scenario
